question: Which country has the world's second-largest natural gas supply?
explanation: Iran has the world's second-largest natural gas supply. According to the Iran Petroleum Ministry, the proved natural gas reserves of Iran are about 1,201 trillion cubic feet or about 17.8% of the world's total reserves. It has the world's second-largest reserves after Russia. As it takes approximately 5,850 cubic feet of gas to equal the energy content of 1-barrel of oil, Iran's gas reserves represent the equivalent of about 205 billion barrels of oil.
